We live in a day and age when many institutions teach diversity in all things except opinion. 

I‚Äôm introducing these pieces of legislation to put a long-overdue check on woke universities and ensure students' First Amendment rights are duly protected.

The Campus Free Speech and Restoration Act requires public and private universities to report First Amendment violations to the Department of Education and publicly share campus policies on free speech. 

Failure to do so would restrict Title IV funding.
The resolution condemns universities that admit students or hire faculty based on their political ideology.
So today I introduced two campus free speech initiatives: a resolution condemning compelled speech on college campuses and the Campus Free Speech Restoration Act.

The sad reality is that students & professors are often-times compelled to sideline their beliefs & conform to the monolithic woke mob. College campuses should be arenas where respectful debate and the free exchange of ideas is promulgated. 

Yet that's not currently the case.

During my time in Congress, I've hosted several campus free speech roundtables. 

I have heard from students and faculty who self-censored their speech in fear of receiving a failing grade or getting turned away from a job due to their own personal beliefs.
